summary: Mircea Jianu, a retired Intelligence officer in his 50s, finds out that his son from a previous marriage went missing in the mountains. As any concerned parent would, he travels there hoping the young man will be found alive and well. But after several days of unavailing searches, Mircea decides to put his own rescue team together, leading to conflict with the local squad. Gradually, the tormented father who refuses to accept the obvious becomes entangled in a frantic battle with man and nature.

reviews.content: not good, uninspiring characters, unattractive characters, bad acting, there's nothing good to say about it unfortunately, well, the mountain scenery was beautiful but that's about all
Awful !!!!!!!! One of the worst movies I ever watched!!!

This movie was TERRIBLE! Seriously do not waste your time. Do anything else with your two hours and your time will be better spent. This movie has large gaps that make no sense, all of the characters are horrible people, and it has NO ending. Seriously the movie just ends like they ran out of money. I cannot stress this enough. A movie that goes slow and takes forever getting there.  Mountain rescue with no action?  Going to save his son and girlfriend and you never see them?  They spend more time off the mountain talking about it than on the mountain searching .  A real bore.
Cinematography Was excellent ~ Voice Dubbing was okay but lacked emotion.   The ending was terrible.

The father was an a-hole.  No redeeming qualities.  Thought he was more privileged than everyone because he had money and connections.  Reminded me of way too many of this type of people in real life.
Horrible and pointless waste of time

This movie dragged on and on, with very little plot twist. Some things don't make sense, like why rescue teams had to start hiking from base every day when there were better options available, such as gondola and road.
Also, the ending sucked, not just because of the sad ending.

It's hard to get into a movie when you don't like the main character. Mircea is a selfish, selfish man. He had an affair with his now wife while married to his former wife. He is already neglecting his new, now very pregnant wife. He pulls out all of the stops to rescue his son and his son's girlfriend, but at what expense? He alienates everyone around him. He is a first class jerk with a capital J. Ultimately, I get the point of the movie. But it's no where near enough to make me like this film

A movie that emphasizes what a dad, in a corrupt system thinks in case of extreme emergency. An example of a good difference between wealth and poor people. A good example of what power money can offer when you have it.
Very silly story, great landscape. Decided to watch with original language and subtitles as american dubbed sounded silly also...don't waste your time.

Don't waste your time.  It moves from one angsty scene to another with NO resolution or payoff; to include the non-ending.  Literally a Sisyphean task to watch this movie watching a man who is trapped like Sisyphus.  And don't be fooled about some Romanian art house BS; if this is what passes for Romanian ‘high drama', well all I can do is yawn.  This was akin to drying paint as I waited in vain for something - anything to happen - the pure misery of ‘it's gotta get better, something has to happen' is the ONLY reason I watched this drivel to the end.

I didn't completely dislike this film, but it's so infuriating and frustrating!! It's definitely not an action packed thriller, so if that's what you're after, don't bother! I don't want to reveal any spoilers, but I'm just saying these film ticks along with no ending, the description is deceiving. I was shouting come on!! Towards the end. What's good about it, is it's a realistic take on what could happen in this situation and the father's devotion to his son is really sweet. Would not recommend it though

Incredibly tedious piece with no plot, no development, and no ending. Just an endless series of angst ridden scenes between the father, his wives, the rescuers, et al, repeating themselves over and over again. Don't waste your time.

The Man Who Moves Mountains is beautifully shot in stunning Romanian landscapes, but the story and especially the ending will leave you feeling empty and unfulfilled. Didn't move us as much as it should have.

A new Romanian drama on Netflix. A wealthy father struggled against nature as he would not stop at anything to rescue his son, who was lost in the snowy mountain.

The synopsis really sounded like this movie would be an intense thriller. Instead, this was a deep and bleak character study of a father who tried everything to save his son. Going through Letterboxd and Rotten Tomatoes, I saw that many did not like this movie, and I believed that they did not understand the message. 

The father character is not a nice person. He's an affluent man who tried to use all his wealth and connections while manipulating and coercing others to help him. For him, others' safety did not matter too much to him. This did not make the father a likable character in audiences' eyes. However, I still found this movie to be powerful despite its depressing color because it showed the resilience and obsession of a parent, regardless of how good of a person the parent is. It should not be surprising that even some of the most evil persons would do anything to keep their loved ones safe. The father character was selfish and a bully, but being on his shoe, I doubt that many parents would do any different. 

As I said before, this is not some thriller or tear-jerking drama. It's very slow, and the ending would leave many unsatisfied and even annoyed. However, for me, this ending effectively emphasized the theme of how parents would never give up on their children. Even more powerful was the fact that the movie was based on a true story. 

Overall, a unique drama about the power of parental love. 8.5/10
